intro: Copaiba elliptica, commonly known as Brazilian frankincense, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its elliptical leaves and aromatic resinous sap. The plant produces a valuable essential oil and balsam, which has been used for centuries in traditional medicine. Its bark and leaves contain compounds with anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Copaiba elliptica plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
